title: Enthalpy change for formation of HCl

content.question: Bond Type Average Bond Enthalpy <math alttext="H H bond" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>H</mtext><mo>−</mo><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="436 kilojoules per mole" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>436</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="C l C l bond" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext><mo>−</mo><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="243 kilojoules per mole" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>243</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="H C l bond" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>H</mtext><mo>−</mo><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="432 kilojoules per mole" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>432</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> The formation of hydrogen chloride gas is represented by the chemical equation <math alttext="H 2 gas plus C l 2 gas react to produce 2 H C l gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mo>+</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>l</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mo>→</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>H</mtext><mtext>C</mtext><mtext>l</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. Based on the bond enthalpy data in the table above, what is the approximate enthalpy change for the reaction?

choices.label: <math alttext="negative 247 kilojoules per mole of reaction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>247</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
